div.l: Buttokis brode and brestis round and hiȝe
But feir͗e was her͗e heer I wol nat ly
The ꝐPerson of the Town̄ for she was feir͗e
In purpose was to make her͗e his heyr͗e
Bothe of his Catel and of his mesuage
And straunge he made it of her mariage
His purpose was to be stowe her͗e hiȝe
In to som̄ worthy blode of Auncetry
For holy Chirchis goodis must be spendyn̄
Of holy Chirchis blode þat is discendyn̄
Therfor he wold his holy blode honour͗e
Thogh that holy Chirch shuld devour͗e
Grete sokyn̄ had this myller out of dout
With whete and malt of al þe lond about
And namly ther͗e was agrete colage
Men clepe it the Soler hal of Cambrigg
Ther͗e was her whete ⁊and eke her malt I ground
And on a day it happid in astound
Sik lay this Mancipil on a malady
Men went wisly that he shuld dy
For wich this Miller stale bothe mele ⁊and corn̄
An hundrit tyme more þan he did be forn̄
For there be forn̄ he stale but acurtesy
But nowe he was a thefe outragiously
For wich the warden̄ chid ⁊and made fare
But ther͗e of set the myller nat a tare
He crakid bost and seid it was nat so
Than̄ were þere pore clerkis to
That dweldyn in this hal of wich I sey
Testyfe they were and lusty for to pley
And only for her myrth and revelry
Oppon̄ the wardyn̄ bisely they cry
To ȝeue hem leve but a litil stounde
To go to the myl and se her corn̄ I ground
And hardely they durst ley her nek
The miller shuld nat stele half a pek
